result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $30 to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund, payable by the end of the sentence.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.   Doc to collect monetary sums/ amounts from 25% of prison funds.

08-03-15/ Daniel L Konkol
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect the correct date the offense was committed as March 1, 2015 at Milwaukee, WI

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that he cannot posses firearms or body armor and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT with the victim.  
NO violations of criminal law rising to Probable Cause.

Defendant ordered to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.   
Pay any monetary amounts not paid while in the institution.   
Have a sex offender evaluation and follow-up with counseling or treatment, as recommended. 
Court advised defendant that he must comply with sex offender reporting requirements under 301.45.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) have a sex offender evaluation and follow up with counseling or treatment as recommended; 4) no contact with the victim; 5) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Robert A Hunt in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert A Hunt in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, he must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements under 301.45 and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years with 128 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection; pay restitution of $30 to the Crime Victim Compensation program by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Letter from the Crime Victim Compensation Program received and filed./ds
Letter from the defendant for sentencing received andfiled./ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Case set for sentencing on 7-7-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.

Defendant Robert A Hunt in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert A Hunt in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Third Degree Sexual Assault 940.225(3) a Class G felony.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Robert A Hunt not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has received the medical records and provided a copy to the defense.   Defense needs to check on defendant's revocation status.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Robert A Hunt not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has not received the medical records.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Robert A Hunt not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State still does not have the medical records.  They need two more weeks and moves for an adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Robert A Hunt not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has not received the medical records yet.  Case set for further pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Robert A Hunt not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs medical records.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript (10 pages) commencing 03/12/2015. received and filed.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Robert A Hunt in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert A Hunt in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Upon oral motion of the State, Court amends the complaint on page 2 to reflect the correct spelling "Kurowski". Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Michael Kurowski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TMH.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert A Hunt in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert A Hunt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
